definitions.title: a.
definitions.body: a weight (also fr. shape), [[כִּכַּר עׂפֶרֶת]] Zec 5:7 a weight of lead, serving as cover of an ephah.

definitions.title: b.
definitions.body: a particular unit of weight, talent, usu. of gold or silver:—[[זׇהָבּ]]´[[כ]] 2Sa 12:30, 2Ki 9:14 + 18 t.; [[כֶּסֶף]] ´[[כ]] 1Ki 20:39, 2Ki 5:5 + 21 t.; but also of iron, [[בַּרְזֶל]] 1Ch 29:7, and bronze [[נְחשֶׁת]] Ex 38:29, 1Ch 29:7.—The weight of the talent was 58.944 kilogr. (= 129.97 lbs.) acc. to older (Bab.) standard, later 49.11 kg. (= 108.29 lbs.) and less; v. Benz:Arch. 187 ff. 194 Now:Arch. i. 208 f.—See also [[שֶׁקֶל]].
